title: Sampling to Diagnose Anemia
question_text:
According to the Mayo Clinic, a patient is considered to be anemic if the blood hematocrit value (the proportion of the blood made up of red blood cells) is lower than $35\%$.
A doctor takes a sample of her patient's blood to check for anemia and measures the hematocrit value to be $38\%$. Which of the following statements is true concerning this study?
I. 38% is the population parameter.
II. The blood drawn by the doctor is the sample for this study.
III. The doctor obtains a sample of blood from the patient in order to draw a conclusion about the overall population of the patient's blood supply.
